Package org.apache.wayang.core.util.fs

Class FileSystems

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.wayang.core.util.fs.FileSystems
  • public class FileSystems
extends java.lang.Object
    Tool to work with FileSystems.

      • getFileSystem

      • getFileSize

        public static java.util.OptionalLong getFileSize​(java.lang.String fileUrl)
        Determine the number of bytes of a given file. This method is not only a short-cut to FileSystem.getFileSize(String) but also caches file sizes for performance reasons.
        Parameters:
        fileUrl - the URL of the file
        Returns:
        the number of bytes of the file if it could be determined

      • findActualInputPaths

        public static java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> findActualInputPaths​(java.lang.String ostensibleInputFile)
        Systems such as Spark do not produce a single output file often times. That method tries to detect such split object files to reassemble them correctly. As of now assumes either a Spark layout or a single file.
        Parameters:
        ostensibleInputFile - the path to that has been written using some framework; might be a dictionary
        Returns:
        all actual input files

      • findActualSingleInputPath

        public static java.lang.String findActualSingleInputPath​(java.lang.String ostensibleInputFile)
        As findActualInputPaths(String) but requires the presence of only a single input file.
